# T-test

This chapter shows how to the three T-Tests for Independent Samples (\@ref(independent)), Paired Samples (\@ref(paired)) and One Sample (\@ref(oneSample)).

## Independent Samples T-Test {#independent}

1. To perform an Independent Samples T-Test you need an outcome variable (continous) and a grouping variable with two levels. Therefore, your data should look something like this:
<img src="images/data_format/data_format_ttest_independent.JPG" width="40%"/>  

2. Select `Analyses -> T-Tests -> Independent Samples T-Test`.  
<img src="images/select/select_ttest_independent.JPG" width="40%"/> 

3. Move your outcome variable to __Dependent Variables__ and your grouping variable to __Grouping Variable__.  
<img src="images/add_var/add_var_ttest_independent.JPG" width="70%"/> 

4. The result is shown in the right panel

## Paired Samples T-Test {#paired}

1. To perform a Paired Samples T-Test you need two continous variables. Therefore, your data should look something like this:  
<img src="images/data_format/data_format_ttest_paired.JPG" width="40%"/>

2. Select `Analyses -> T-Tests -> Paired Samples T-Test`.  
<img src="images/select/select_ttest_paired.JPG" width="40%"/> 

3. Move your outcome variables to __Dependent variables__.
<img src="images/add_var/add_var_ttest_paired.JPG" width="70%"/> 

4. The result is shown in the right panel

## One Sample T-Test {#oneSample}

1. To perform a One Sample T-Test you need a continous variable and a mean to test against. Therefore, your data should look something like this:
<img src="images/data_format/data_format_ttest_one_sample.JPG" alt="Data till One Sample T-Test." width="40%"/>  

2. Select `Analyses -> T-Tests -> One Sample T-Test`.  
<img src="images/select/select_ttest_one_sample.JPG" width="40%"/> 

3. Move your dependent variable to __Dependent Variables__.  
<img src="images/add_var/add_var_ttest_one_sample.JPG" width="70%"/> 

4. Locate the section "Hypothesis" further down, this is where you enter the mean you want to test against.

5. The result is shown in the right panel
